Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan and the Circus Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Paul Bunyan's time in a circus, his unexpected strength, and his conflict with Matto Grasso, leading to Bunyan becoming the new strong man and resolving Grasso's revenge plots.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Initial Performance
sub_scenes.description: The circus arrives in town and Paul Bunyan is introduced as a performer, showcasing his strength to the audience. The public reacts with excitement and wonder at the circus's arrival.

sub_scenes.title: Unexpected Strength and New Opportunity
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan demonstrates unexpected strength by defeating Matto Grasso, leading the circus owner to offer him a job as the new strong man.

narrative_arcs.title: Owner's Explanation and Revelation of Identity
Offering a New Role: The Strong Man

sub_scenes.title: Trouble Brewing and Matto Grasso's Revenge
sub_scenes.description: Trouble arises as Billings confronts Matto Grasso, leading to a fight and Grasso's escape. Grasso, envious of Paul Bunyan's new role, plots revenge involving fire and an ape.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Debut and Grasso's Envy
Grasso's Revenge Plan: Kerosene and Fire
Fire in the Arena and Bunyan's Control

sub_scenes.title: Ape Release and Capture
sub_scenes.description: Matto Grasso releases an ape to cause chaos, but Paul Bunyan quickly recaptures it. The circus workers then pursue Grasso for his actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Grasso's Renewed Frustration and Ape Release Plan
The Chase for the Culprit Begins
Desperate Attempts to Thwart Paul Bunyan in the Arena

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Departure
sub_scenes.description: An unplanned spectacle occurs in the circus ring, leading to Sonny's capture and Paul Bunyan rejecting a job offer to return to a peaceful life in the woods.

narrative_arcs.title: Challenge and Boast in the Circus Ring

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Ogress of Tibet
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Marco Polo's adventure in Tibet, where he encounters a severed head, receives a magical dagger, and faces the Ogress of Tibet to rescue Princess Lotus.

sub_scenes.title: Marco Polo's Initial Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo is introduced in a perilous situation in Tibet, hinting at the dangers of his adventures.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Ogress of Tibet

sub_scenes.title: The Severed Head and the Dagger
sub_scenes.description: A man on horseback discovers a talking severed head who pleads for help and gifts him a magical dagger.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Talking Head and Plea for Help
Gratitude and a Gift of a Sacred Dagger
Direction Towards Princess Lotus and Farewell

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Mourning City
sub_scenes.description: The man on horseback arrives at a city in mourning and learns about the disappearance of Princess Lotus from the King.

narrative_arcs.title: Audience with the Mourning King and the Tale of Princess Lotus

sub_scenes.title: Encounter with the Weeping Woman
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo encounters a weeping woman who leads him to a castle, which turns out to be the lair of the Ogress.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with a Weeping Woman in Distress
Plea for Help and Journey to a Suspect Castle
Entering the Castle and the Witch's 'Pets'
Transformation and Revelation of the Ogress
Confrontation with Tusked Mice and Ogress's Claws

sub_scenes.title: Capture and Escape
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo is captured by the Ogress but manages to escape using the magical dagger, freeing Princess Lotus in the process.

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Reward
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo returns Princess Lotus to her mourning city and palace, where he is rewarded with her hand in marriage.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Mourning City and Palace

Major_Arcs.title: Treasure and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of treasure, betrayal, and revenge, focusing on Jordan's pursuit of Captain Brooking who betrayed him and stole treasure.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction and Prison Setup
sub_scenes.description: A narrator introduces a tale of treasure. A prisoner in a penal colony is approached by a guard.

sub_scenes.title: The Treasure Deal and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: The prisoner proposes a deal to Captain Brooking, offering half of a buried treasure in exchange for help escaping.

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal and Revenge Vow
sub_scenes.description: Captain Brooking betrays the prisoner, taking the treasure and escaping. Jordan vows revenge.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Betrayal and Captain's Departure
Jordan's Outrage and Vow of Revenge
Years Pass, Freedom, and Pursuit of Revenge

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Meeting
sub_scenes.description: Years later, Jordan tracks down Captain Brooking and confronts him, leading to a midnight meeting at Brooking's house.

narrative_arcs.title: Jordan's Vigil and the Officer's Departure

sub_scenes.title: Attic Showdown and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The midnight meeting turns violent in the attic, where Jordan confronts Brooking about the treasure, leading to a deadly fight and police intervention.

narrative_arcs.title: Ascent to the Attic and Treasure Reveal
Sound of Gunfire and Initial Investigation
Concluding Monologue on Treasure and Evil

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc involves investigating the haunted Matthews estate, dealing with the ghost of Vincent Matthews, and finding resolution through forgiveness and love.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to the Haunting and Matthews' Backstory
sub_scenes.description: The story sets the scene with Vincent Matthews' sentencing and declaration of hatred, then introduces the problem of the haunted Matthews estate.

narrative_arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate and the Investigator's Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and First Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup arrives at the haunted estate, ignores warnings, and encounters the ghost of Vincent Matthews.

narrative_arcs.title: Ignoring the Warning and Entering the Haunted House
First Encounter with Vincent Matthews' Ghost

sub_scenes.title: Fight with the Ghost and Philosophical Turn
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup fights Vincent Matthews' ghost, then engages in a philosophical discussion about fear, hate, and salvation.

narrative_arcs.title: The Path to Salvation: Forgiveness and Love

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Vincent is forced to confront Rosalind's ghost, who offers forgiveness and brotherly love, leading to their peaceful departure and the end of the haunting.

narrative_arcs.title: Physical Subjugation and Assertion of Strength

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Voyages
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc recounts Henry Hudson's voyages in search of the Northwest Passage, his failures, crew discontent, and ultimate mutiny, highlighting his historical plight.

sub_scenes.title: First Voyage Proposition and Agreement
sub_scenes.description: The story introduces Henry Hudson and the Dutch East India Company's proposition for him to find the Northwest Passage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dutch East India Company's Proposition

sub_scenes.title: First Voyage and Return
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's first voyage faces crew discontent, initial hope upon entering the Hudson River, and eventual disappointment, leading to their return to Holland.

narrative_arcs.title: Crew's Discontent and Threat of Mutiny
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
Hudson's Reflection and Order to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage, Icebound, and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: Hudson embarks on a second voyage, gets trapped in ice, leading to crew despair and ultimately mutiny against him.

narrative_arcs.title: Setting Sail Again for the Northwest Passage
Ship Stuck in Ice and Crew's Despair
The Ice Melts and Conflict Over Voyage Direction

sub_scenes.title: Mutineers' Fate
sub_scenes.description: The mutineers return home to face the consequences of their actions, including arrest and punishment.

narrative_arcs.title: Return and Reckoning for the Mutineers

Major_Arcs.title: The Arabian Knight
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Hassan, the Arabian Knight, on his mission to rescue the Sheik's daughter from Kurgan, the Tartar leader, culminating in a trial by combat and a romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Mission Briefing
sub_scenes.description: The Arabian Knight, Hassan, is introduced and tasked by the Caliph with rescuing the Sheik's kidnapped daughter from Kurgan.

sub_scenes.title: Journey and Warning
sub_scenes.description: Hassan sets out on his mission, encountering signs of danger at the oasis and receiving a warning from a traveler about the Tartars.

narrative_arcs.title: Hassan's Determined Journey to the Oasis
Encounter and Warning at the Oasis

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Capture
sub_scenes.description: Hassan infiltrates the Tartar camp, gathers intel, but is eventually discovered and captured by guards.

narrative_arcs.title: Inside the Camp and Gaining Intel
Suspicion and Confrontation at the Tent

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is challenged to a trial by combat by Kurgan, facing three armed fighters unarmed, and he uses his wits to win.

narrative_arcs.title: Dirt in the Eyes and First Foe Down
Demanding the Reward and Kurgan's Praise

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Kurgan honors his word, and Hassan and the Sheik's daughter share a moment of gratitude and romantic connection as they return to Bagdad.

narrative_arcs.title: Imminent Departure and The One Thing
